channel.title: Retarded computer discussion
channel.description:
OK guys so I have notice a possible exploit on my BSD server. You see if one successfully implements the Schönhage-Strassen algorithm in batch code they can construct fake SYN packets and use them to port hack me and gain access to the cpu's arithmetic logic unit and overflow a buffer in the java kernal. This in effect could cause the system to segfault making the OS freeze and the GPU overheat. Then I need a restart.
Can anyone help? :confused:

item.title: Retarded computer discussion
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Then I need a restart.

To Dix Your Problem You Simply Leave Your Computer Off.

Read full topic

Read full topic
